title: Product to Sum Formula for sine
text: The product to sum formula for rewriting the product of two sine functions is sin(a)sin(b)=1/2[cos(a-b)-cos(a+b)].

title: Substitute Angles
text: To write the formula for the sum of sines as a product, identify and plug in the unknown values of angles a and $$b$$.

title: Identify Unknown Angle
text: From the formula of sin(a)sin(b), what is the value of the angle a in the problem?

title: Identify Unknown Angle
text: From the formula of sin(a)sin(b), what is the value of the angle $$b$$ in the problem?

title: Constant Multiplier
text: The $$16$$ is multiplied by the $$\frac{1}{2}$$ in the formula to remain as a constant multiplier for the difference of cosines.
